alert.note: Alert for Northern Piscataquis; Northwest Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 3:12PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Piscataquis County through 400 PM EDT... At 312 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Churchill Dam, or 9 miles south of Clayton Lake, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Churchill Dam. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
